info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 8:13PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Widespread showers and isolated thunderstorms will produce gusty winds across Southside Virginia and the northern North Carolina Piedmont through 915 PM EST... At 809 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking widespread showers and clusters of thundertorms across much of the Virginia Southside and northern Piedmont of North Carolina. The strongest thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Evington, to 6 miles east of Aiken Summit, to near Kernersville. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Danville... Eden... Reidsville... South Boston... Altavista... Wentworth... and Yanceyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Additional statements will be issued as conditions warrant.
